question: Do human embryonic stem cells have the capacity to differentiate into derivatives of all three embryonic germ layers (ectoderm, mesoderm, and endoderm)? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Embryonic stem (ES) cell lines derived from human blastocysts have the developmental potential to form derivatives of all three embryonic germ layers even after prolonged culture.
content.source_2: Despite typical ES morphology and marker expression, SCNT-hES-1 cells produced teratomas in severe combined immunodeficient mice that lacked definitive endodermal lineages, indicating restriction to ectodermal and mesodermal derivatives only.
content.source_3: Although human embryonic stem cells could be maintained undifferentiated with robust proliferation, subsequent differentiation assays yielded predominantly ectodermal and mesodermal progeny, with endodermal markers not detected under standard conditions.
